name: Destroy the Source
description:
You are an Unturned, immune to infectious zombie bites, and the only remaining member of an expedition to destroy the infection's Source. Will you be able to complete the mission?

A point and click adventure game in the style of the MacVenture series (Shadowgate, Deja Vu, Uninvited). Primarily mouse-controlled, although there are a few keyboard shortcuts.

Controls:

  • Left mouse: select item / drag (drop on another item to USE ON)
  • Right mouse: USE item or USE selected item on clicked item
  • Middle mouse: GO to place under cursor
  • Inventory view
    • Top half is your inventory, bottom half is the currently opened container
    • SELF represents yourself - you can interact with this like any other item
  • Menu in the lower left
    • Menu: Bring up the game menu (save/load/new/quit/etc.)
    • Map: Nothing (unimplemented
    • Back: Move back to a room behind your view
  • Shortcuts
    • F1: Toggle help display in upper-right
    • F6: Quick save
    • F9: Quick load
    • F12: Quick new game

Version 0.0.2 was submitted after the deadline but fixes these bugs from Version 0.0.1:

  • If you save/load (or die/continue), a critical item in the game will disappear, so unfortunately you have to do it all in one go. But it's pretty short.
  • If you save/load (or die/continue), the music stops.
  • Clicking "back" during a transition makes things go haywire (not fixed in 0.0.2, possibly in 0.0.3!)

The game is missing a lot of things, but chief among them are:

  • Sound effects and custom music (I used songs from my royalty free library, and there are no sounds... shame on me as an audio guy)
  • Large chunks of story (it might not make any sense)
  • Interesting puzzles (a lot of things are just there)
  • More subtle story delivery (it's a lot up-front)

The system should be relatively robust, but there may be bugs such as:

  • Save/load causing weird things to happen.
  • The inventory having "invisible" items.
  • Items returning from nothingness.
  • Mac and Linux versions are completely untested but should be fine.

Please let me know if you find any bugs like this! Thanks for playing.
